 To apply for admission into the Far North Nursing School FNNS Application Form 2024, kindly follow the link and apply online. All applications must be submitted online

Far North Nursing School

Far North Nursing School is located in the Limpopo province of South Africa. The school provides nursing education and training to individuals who wish to become professional nurses, enrolled nurses or nursing auxiliaries. Here are some key facts about Far North Nursing School:

Programs: Far North Nursing School offers nursing education and training programs for professional nurses, enrolled nurses, and nursing auxiliaries.

Accreditation: Far North Nursing School is accredited by the South African Nursing Council (SANC), the regulatory body for nursing education and practice in South Africa.

Facilities: The school has modern facilities, including a library, skills lab, computer lab, and a clinical learning centre.

Admission requirements: Applicants must meet the minimum admission requirements for their program of interest, including academic qualifications and health requirements.

Application process: Prospective students can apply to Far North Nursing School by completing an application form and submitting it with supporting documents.

Financial aid: Far North Nursing School offers financial aid to students who demonstrate financial need and meet the eligibility requirements.

Clinical practice: Students in nursing programs must complete clinical practice in hospitals and other healthcare facilities to gain practical experience and skills.

Graduation and certification: Upon completing the nursing program, students must write the SANC Board Exam to become certified as professional nurses, enrolled nurses or nursing auxiliaries.

Career opportunities: Graduates of Far North Nursing School can pursue careers in various healthcare settings, including hospitals, clinics, and community health centres.

What to Know About the Far North Nursing School Application Form Portal

The Far North Nursing School FNNS Application portal is designed to accept applications from candidates seeking admission into the University. In the portal, applicants can Purchase application forms, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print acknowledgement slips, check the admission list, etc.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible for admission to the FNNS application portal, candidates must;

  • Have a Secondary School Leaving Certificate
  • Meet National Senior Certificate (NSC) requirement for admission into Higher Certificate
  • Grade 12 certificate applicants are of added advantage
  • Must write the NBTs for admission to FNNS on/before 15 October 2024.
  • FPS of 480 or above.
  • NBT scores of Upper
  • Intermediate for AL & QL
  • Mathematics 60%
  • English HL 50%
  • English FAL 60%

FNNS online Application

Far North Nursing School does not have an online application system on its website. Prospective students can obtain an application form by visiting the school’s campus or by contacting the admissions office directly.

To apply to Far North Nursing School, follow these steps:

Obtain an application form: Visit the school’s campus or contact the admissions office to obtain an application form.

Complete the application form: Fill out the application form completely and accurately, providing all required information and supporting documents.

Apply: Submit the completed application form and required documents to the admissions office by the deadline.

Wait for a response: Wait for a response from the school’s admissions office regarding the status of your application. This can take several weeks.

If accepted, enrol in the program: If your application is accepted, you will need to enrol in the program and pay any required fees.

How to Apply | FNNS Application Form 2024

Eligible candidates can click here to apply.

Follow the steps below

  • Visit Application portal
  • Choose the type of Application (Undergraduate, Post Graduate, Semester Studies)
  • Fill and complete all necessary pages
  • Pay Application fees where required

Far North Nursing School Application Required Documents

To apply to FNNS, you need to submit the following documentation:

  • A completed application form
  • A copy of your results for the latest school year
  • A copy of your ID
  • If you have attended another higher education institution, we need a copy of your academic transcript

Downloading Far North Nursing School Prospectus

To download the Far North Nursing School prospectus, follow these steps:

Go to the Far North Nursing School website: Visit the school’s website at https://www.fnns.co.za/

Navigate to the prospectus: Look for a link or tab on the website that says “Prospectus” or “Downloads.” Click on this link to be directed to the prospectus download page.

Download the prospectus: Once you are on the prospectus download page, click on the link to download the prospectus. The prospectus will usually be in a PDF format, so ensure you have a PDF reader installed on your device to view the document.

Save the prospectus: Once you have downloaded it, save it to your device or print a hard copy for future reference.

Far North Nursing School Contact Centre

You can contact Far North Nursing School using the following information:

Address: Far North Nursing School 94 Burger Street, Polokwane Limpopo Province, South Africa

Telephone: +27 15 291 1120 +27 15 291 1162

Email: info@fnns.co.za

Website: https://www.fnns.co.za/

Social Media: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Far-North-Nursing-School-106874431353602/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/farnorthschool

For more information regarding the application for admission into the Far North Nursing School, kindly drop your messages in the comment box below.

FAQ – Far North Nursing School Application

Q: What programs does Far North Nursing School offer?
A: Far North Nursing School offers programs in nursing education, including a one-year Enrolled Nursing Auxiliary program and a two-year Enrolled Nursing program.

Q: What are the admission requirements for Far North Nursing School?

A: The admission requirements for Far North Nursing School may vary depending on the program. Generally, applicants must have a National Senior Certificate or equivalent qualification with a minimum pass rate in certain subjects, meet the minimum age requirement, and have good physical and mental health.

Q: How do I apply to Far North Nursing School?

A: To apply to Far North Nursing School, obtain an application form by visiting the school’s campus or contacting the admissions office directly. Complete the application form and submit it with any required documents to the admissions office by the specified deadline.

Q: Does Far North Nursing School offer online applications?

A: Far North Nursing School does not offer online applications. Prospective students must obtain an application form from the school’s campus or by contacting the admissions office directly.

Q: Is there an application fee for Far North Nursing School?

A: The school’s website does not mention an application fee. It is recommended that you contact the admissions office directly to inquire about any fees associated with the application process.

Q: How can I check the status of my application to Far North Nursing School?

A: To check the status of your application, contact the school’s admissions office directly. Be sure to have your application reference number or any other relevant information to help them locate your application in their system.
